title: Dillyn Leyds
text:
Dillyn Yullrich Leyds (born in <a href="Somerset%20West">Somerset West</a>, South Africa) is a South African <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player for the <a href="South%20Africa%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">South Africa national team</a> and <a href="Stade%20Rochelais">Stade Rochelais</a> in the French <a href="Top%2014">Top 14</a>. He can play as a fullback, fly-half or wing.
Career.
Youth and Varsity rugby.
Leyds was educated at <a href="Western%20Province%20Prep">Western Province Preparatory School</a> and went on to <a href="Diocesan%20College">Bishops College</a> in <a href="Cape%20Town">Cape Town</a>, where he played for their First XV rugby side in 2009 and 2010, alongside players such as <a href="Nizaam%20Carr">Nizaam Carr</a>, <a href="Oli%20Kebble">Oli Kebble</a>, <a href="Johnny%20K%C3%B4tze">Johnny Kôtze</a>, <a href="Sam%20Lane%20%28rugby%20player%29">Sam Lane</a> and <a href="Tim%20Swiel">Tim Swiel</a>.
He represented Western Province at various age-group levels. In 2010, he was included in both their Under-18 Academy Week and <a href="Craven%20Week">Craven Week</a> sides. The following year, the played for the side in the <a href="2011%20Under-19%20Provincial%20Championship">2011 Under-19 Provincial Championship</a>, where he scored 133 points in 13 starts to finish second in the points-scoring charts and help his side reach the quarter-finals of the competition. He was a regular in the squad during the <a href="2012%20Under-21%20Provincial%20Championship">2012</a> and <a href="2013%20Under-21%20Provincial%20Championship">2013</a> Provincial Championships, helping them reach a final in the former and winning the competition in 2013.
In <a href="2012%20Varsity%20Rugby%23Varsity%20Cup">2012</a> and <a href="2013%20Varsity%20Cup">2013</a>, he also played <a href="Varsity%20Cup">Varsity Cup</a> rugby for the . He was jointly the third-highest try scorer in 2012, averaging one try per match in his seven appearances.
2012 IRB Junior World Championship.
In 2012, Leyds was a member of the <a href="South%20Africa%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">South African Under-20</a> side that won the <a href="2012%20IRB%20Junior%20World%20Championship">2012 IRB Junior World Championship</a> on home soil. Leyds started their Pool Stage matches against <a href="Ireland%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">Ireland</a> and <a href="England%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">England</a>, their semi-final match against <a href="Argentina%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">Argentina</a> and the final against <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">New Zealand</a>, helping his side to a 22–16 victory over the defending champions to win the title for the first time ever.
Western Province.
Leyds was included in the squad for the <a href="2013%20Vodacom%20Cup">2013 Vodacom Cup</a> competition. His first class debut came against the <a href="Argentina">Argentinean</a> invitational side the in <a href="Cape%20Town">Cape Town</a>. He came on as a second-half substitute and scored a conversion with his first touch of the ball, plus added a penalty later to help Western Province to a 28–17 victory. He also appeared in their semi-final match against the , but couldn't prevent them being knocked out of the competition following a 44–25 loss.
Western Force and Perth Spirit.
Leyds moved to Australia to join <a href="Perth">Perth</a>-based <a href="Super%20Rugby">Super Rugby</a> franchise the for the <a href="2014%20Super%20Rugby%20season">2014 Super Rugby season</a>, where he was named in their Wider Training Group. He was included in a matchday squad for the first time for their Round 16 match against the in <a href="Christchurch">Christchurch</a>. He made three substitute appearances for the Force during the season, appearing in their matches against the Crusaders, and .
He was also named in the side that played in the <a href="2014%20National%20Rugby%20Championship">2014 National Rugby Championship</a>. He made five appearances in the competition and scored a try in their match against the .
Return to Western Province.
In March 2014, announced that Leyds would return to the <a href="Cape%20Town">Cape Town</a>-based side for the <a href="2014%20Currie%20Cup%20Premier%20Division">2014 Currie Cup Premier Division</a> season. Due to ongoing commitments with the and , he only started training with Western Province towards the end of September 2014.<ref name="DHL WP injury report – 29/09/14"></ref>
Stormers.
He made his Super Rugby debut for the on the wing against the scoring a try and helping the Stormers to shock the Bulls 17–29 in <a href="Pretoria">Pretoria</a> on the opening weekend of <a href="2015%20Super%20Rugby%20season">2015 Super Rugby season</a> on 14 February 2015.
Stade Rochelais.
Leyds signed for French <a href="Top%2014">Top 14</a> outfit, <a href="Stade%20Rochelais">La Rochelle</a>, ahead of the <a href="2020%E2%80%9321%20Top%2014%20season">2020–21 season</a>.
